intro: Gamochaeta cabrerae, commonly known as the Cape Verde ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, typically in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, showing adaptability to arid and saline conditions. Gamochaeta cabrerae is often found in open areas with well-drained soils, contributing to the unique flora of the region.
